intro: Miconia lucida subsp. pariensis, commonly known as the Pariná Miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary and secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
